intro: Felicia westiae, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Felicia westiae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its bright, cheerful appearance.
